1.title: Counting and number meaning
1.masteryText: Count, read, and write numbers to at least 40; match numbers to quantities; solve very simple addition stories using objects or drawings.
1.quizGuidanceText: Visual and oral-friendly items; minimal symbols.
sampleItems: There are 5 apples. Add 2 more. How many now? Draw it.

2.title: Addition and subtraction within 10
2.masteryText: Add and subtract within 10 using drawings and equations; understand addition as putting together and subtraction as taking apart.
2.quizGuidanceText: Story problems and picture models; no fluency timing.
sampleItems: 7 birds are on a tree. 3 fly away. How many left?

3.title: Place value and numbers to 100
3.masteryText: Understand tens and ones; compare two-digit numbers; add within 100 using place-value strategies (no standard algorithm).

4.title: Measurement, time, and data
4.masteryText: Compare lengths; measure using nonstandard units; tell time to hour and half-hour; organize simple data.
sampleItems: Measure the book with paper clips.
What time is shown on the clock?

5.title: Geometry and equations
5.masteryText: Identify 2D/3D shapes; partition shapes into halves and quarters; understand the equal sign; find unknowns in equations.
sampleItems: Split the shape into 4 equal parts.
Grades 2–12 pacing, CCSS codes, mastery descriptions, quiz guidance, and sample items continue in the
following sections, structured identically to Grade 1.
Teacher handout. Each grade/course is divided into 5 pacing points (≈2 months each). Each point lists exact
CCSS codes, mastery targets, quiz-writing guidance, and sample items. High school is organized by
California\222s typical pathway: Algebra I, Geometry, Algebra II, and Grade 12 advanced options.

1.title: Place value to 100; addition/subtraction foundations
1.masteryText: Read/write/compare numbers to 100; understand tens/ones; solve 1-step add/sub word problems within 100 using drawings/equations.
1.quizGuidanceText: Use base-ten blocks, number lines, and short word problems. Require place-value explanation in 1–2 items.
sampleItems: Which is greater: 73 or 37? Explain using tens/ones.
Sam has 28 stickers and gets 15 more. How many now? Show a strategy.

2.title: Fluency within 20; add/sub within 100
2.masteryText: Fluently add/sub within 20; add/sub within 100 using strategies (compose/decompose tens).
2.quizGuidanceText: Mix light fluency + strategy items. Include one regrouping-in-thinking item.

3.title: Place value to 1,000; add/sub within 1,000
3.masteryText: Read/write/compare to 1,000; add/sub within 1,000 using place value and properties; explain reasoning.
3.quizGuidanceText: Use expanded form and place-value charts; include one multi-step story problem.
sampleItems: A class has 235 books. They get 178 more. How many total?

4.title: Measurement, time, money, and data
4.masteryText: Measure length with standard units; estimate/compare; tell time to nearest 5 minutes; solve money problems; create/read bar graphs (grade-appropriate).
4.quizGuidanceText: Use practical contexts: ruler, clocks, coins, simple graphs; include one interpretation question.
sampleItems: Choose which object is about 12 inches long.
What time is 3:25? Draw the clock hands.
A toy costs 45\242 and a sticker costs 30\242. How much in all?

5.title: Geometry + arrays + even/odd
5.masteryText: Identify/classify shapes; partition into equal shares; recognize even/odd; model equal groups/arrays.
sampleItems: Draw an array for 3 rows of 4.
How many faces does a cube have?

1.title: Multiplication meanings + word problems; unknowns
1.masteryText: Interpret products/quotients; solve multiplication/division stories; represent with arrays/number lines; find unknowns.
1.quizGuidanceText: Use pictures + equations. Include one unknown-factor item.
sampleItems: Write an equation for 5 groups of 3.

2.title: Fluency and properties
2.masteryText: Use properties to compute; fluency within 100; connect multiplication and division facts.
2.quizGuidanceText: Include one distributive strategy item; small fluency set.

3.title: Fractions as numbers
3.masteryText: Understand unit fractions and fractions on number lines; explain fraction meaning.
3.quizGuidanceText: Use shaded models + number lines; avoid fraction operations.
sampleItems: Place 2/3 on a number line from 0 to 1.

4.title: Measurement & data: time, mass, volume; graphs
4.masteryText: Tell time to nearest minute; measure/estimate mass and volume; make and interpret scaled graphs.
sampleItems: A graph uses scale 2. If a bar is at 8, how many items?
Is 1 liter more or less than 500 mL?

5.title: Area, perimeter, geometry; fraction compare intro
5.masteryText: Find area as equal squares; distinguish area vs perimeter; classify shapes; partition shapes; compare fractions with same numerator/denominator.
5.quizGuidanceText: Use grid paper; include one area vs perimeter item.
sampleItems: Find area of a 4 by 6 rectangle.
A shape has perimeter 12 units. Give one possible rectangle.

1.title: Place value, rounding, add/sub; multi-step problems
1.masteryText: Read/write/compare multi-digit numbers; round; add/sub multi-digit; solve multi-step whole-number problems.
1.quizGuidanceText: Include rounding reasoning and one multi-step word problem.
sampleItems: A store sold 1,248 Mon and 2,035 Tue. Total?

2.title: Multiplication/division; factors; primes
2.masteryText: Multiply and divide multi-digit; identify factors/multiples; prime/composite.
2.quizGuidanceText: Use area model + standard algorithm; include factor pairs.

3.title: Fraction equivalence and comparison
3.masteryText: Generate equivalent fractions; compare with reasoning; use models/number lines.

4.title: Fraction operations; decimals
4.masteryText: Add/sub like denominators; multiply fraction\327whole; decimals tenths/hundredths; compare decimals.
sampleItems: 3 ribbons of length 3/4 yard. Total length?

5.title: Measurement, line plots, angles; geometry symmetry
5.masteryText: Convert units; interpret line plots (incl fractions); measure angles; identify/draw lines/angles; symmetry.
5.quizGuidanceText: Use protractor item; include conversion and line plot.

1.title: Expressions + decimal place value
1.masteryText: Write/interpret expressions; analyze patterns; understand decimals to thousandths; compare/round decimals.
1.quizGuidanceText: One expression item + one decimal rounding.

2.title: Whole-number & decimal operations
2.masteryText: Multiply multi-digit; divide with 2-digit divisors (grade-level); operate with decimals.

3.title: Add/sub fractions (unlike denominators)
3.masteryText: Add/sub unlike denominators using equivalence; solve word problems.

4.title: Multiply/divide fractions
4.masteryText: Multiply fractions/mixed; divide unit fractions by whole numbers and vice versa; apply to problems.
4.quizGuidanceText: Include visual model for fraction division.

5.title: Measurement/volume + coordinate plane + classify shapes
5.masteryText: Convert units; compute volume; graph points; classify 2D figures.
5.quizGuidanceText: Include volume reasoning and coordinate graph.
sampleItems: Is every square a rectangle? Explain.

1.title: Ratios, rates, percent
1.masteryText: Use ratio language; compute unit rates; solve ratio/rate/percent problems using tables/diagrams.
1.quizGuidanceText: Tables + double number lines; one percent-of item.
sampleItems: If 12 is 30% of a number, find the number.

2.title: Fraction/decimal operations; GCF/LCM
2.masteryText: Divide fractions; divide multi-digit; operate with decimals; apply GCF/LCM.
2.quizGuidanceText: One fraction-division model + one LCM context.
sampleItems: Bell every 6 min and 8 min: together when?

3.title: Integers + coordinate plane
3.masteryText: Compare/order integers; opposites and absolute value; plot points; interpret coordinates in context.
3.quizGuidanceText: Real contexts; one absolute value/distance item.

4.title: Expressions/equations/inequalities
4.masteryText: Write/evaluate expressions; use variables; solve equations; solve inequalities and graph solutions.
4.quizGuidanceText: Translate words to algebra + inequality graph.

5.title: Geometry + statistics
5.masteryText: Area of polygons; surface area/volume; summarize data with center/spread; interpret distributions.
sampleItems: From dot plot, find mean and describe spread.

1.title: Proportional relationships
1.masteryText: Determine proportional relationships; represent with tables/graphs/equations; compute unit rates.
sampleItems: Complete table for y=2.5x when x=6.

2.title: Percent applications
2.masteryText: Discounts, tax, tip, percent change, simple interest; solve real-world percent problems.
sampleItems: Simple interest on $300 at 4% for 2 years.

3.title: Rational numbers + expressions
3.masteryText: Operate with rational numbers; simplify expressions; combine like terms.

4.title: Equations and inequalities
4.masteryText: Solve multi-step equations/inequalities; model problems with equations.
4.quizGuidanceText: Write equation from story; graph inequality.

5.title: Geometry + probability + sampling
5.masteryText: Scale drawings; angle relationships; circles; volume; sampling; probability of compound events.

1.title: Irrational numbers; exponents; scientific notation
1.masteryText: Understand irrational numbers; exponent rules; scientific notation operations.
1.quizGuidanceText: One irrational classification + one sci-notation op.

2.title: Linear equations and systems
2.masteryText: Slope and linear models; solve linear equations; solve systems and interpret intersections.
2.quizGuidanceText: Slope from tables/graphs; one system context.

3.title: Functions
3.masteryText: Define/evaluate functions; compare functions; interpret linear functions as models.

4.title: Transformations; congruence; similarity
4.masteryText: Rigid motions and dilations; congruence/similarity via transformations.

5.title: Pythagorean theorem; bivariate data
5.masteryText: Use Pythagorean theorem and distance; analyze scatter plots and linear models; interpret association/outliers.

1.title: Linear relationships
1.masteryText: Interpret expressions; create and solve linear equations; interpret graphs (intercepts, rate of change).
sampleItems: From graph, identify slope and intercept meaning.

2.title: Systems and inequalities
2.masteryText: Solve systems; solve and graph inequalities; interpret solution regions.
sampleItems: Graph y\263-2x+4 and y<x-1; describe overlap.

3.title: Exponential models
3.masteryText: Distinguish linear vs exponential; build exponential functions; interpret parameters.

4.title: Quadratics
4.masteryText: Graph/interpret quadratics; solve by factoring/completing square/quadratic formula; connect roots to intercepts.

5.title: Polynomials operations
5.masteryText: Add/subtract/multiply polynomials; evaluate functions; connect structure to behavior (intro).

1.title: Transformations & congruence
1.masteryText: Use rigid motions to define congruence; apply triangle congruence criteria.
sampleItems: Describe transformation mapping A to A'.

2.title: Proof & triangle theorems
2.masteryText: Prove theorems; use reasoning chains; parallelogram properties.
2.quizGuidanceText: Proof scaffolds + one full proof prompt.
sampleItems: Outline proof: base angles in isosceles triangle.

3.title: Similarity & trig
3.masteryText: Similarity; proportions; trig ratios; solve right triangles.
sampleItems: Similar triangles scale factor -> missing side.
Tree height with angle 35\260 and distance 20m.

4.title: Circles
4.masteryText: Circle theorems, tangents, inscribed angles; circle equations.

5.title: Coordinate geometry + volume + modeling
sampleItems: Model a constraint problem and explain.

1.title: Polynomials & rational expressions
1.masteryText: Polynomial identities and division; rational expressions with restrictions.

3.title: Exponential & logarithmic
3.masteryText: Growth/decay; logs; solve exponential/log equations; interpret parameters.

4.title: Trigonometry
4.masteryText: Unit circle; graphs; identities; trig equations; periodic models.

5.title: Statistics & regression
5.masteryText: Correlation, regression, residuals, model fit, interpretation.

1.title: Functions, composition, inverses
1.masteryText: Composition/inverses; function families; end behavior and transformations.

2.title: Advanced trig modeling
2.masteryText: Sinusoidal modeling; identities; trig equations on intervals.
sampleItems: Rewrite sin(2x) using sin x and cos x.

3.title: Conditional probability
3.masteryText: Conditional probability and independence; tables/trees; reasoning.
sampleItems: Two draws without replacement: prob both red (3R,2B).
From a two-way table compute P(A|B).

4.title: Expected value & decisions
4.masteryText: Expected value; compare strategies; risk/reward modeling.
sampleItems: EV of game: win $10 (0.2) else 0; cost $3.
Compare two plans using expected monthly cost.
